specleanr 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    Environmental outlier detection in fish species records. Detecting environmental outliers in environmental data for plants.

Function reference

All functions

adjustboxplots()
Adjust the boxplots bounding fences using medcouple to flag suspicious outliers (Hubert & Vandervieren 2008).
batch_extract()
Extract oultiers for multiple species
bestmethod()
Identifies the best method for outlier detection for a single species.
boots()
Creating sub-samples for modeling evaluation.
check_dates()
Harmonise dates form different data sets
check_names()
Check species names for inconsistencies
check_natura()
Check whether species is on NATURA2000 list
check_taxa_names()
standardize species names.
clean_data()
Extract final clean data using either absolute or best method generated outliers.
clean_data_extract()
Extract cleaned record for multiple species.
clean_date()
Internal function to clean dates before checking for consitencies
clean_names()
Internal function to clean names before checking them with fishbase
cosine()
Cosine similarity index based on (Gautam & Kulkarni 2014; Joy & Renumol 2020)
datacleaner-class
Outlier detection class for multiple methods
dataonline-class
Data online class
dateformats
Standard date formats
dep()
Threshold dependent parameters for species distribution model evaluations.
detect()
Flags outliers or no outliers for multiple outlier methods.
distboxplot()
Distribution boxplot
distr_ranges()
Determine species distribution ranges based on IUCN RedList.
.cache()
caching data
.gbdownload()
Downloads the global basin data based on Tesedesco at al., 2017
.nearthdownload()
NatureEarth data
downloadnatura()
Download NATURA2000 data
ecological_ranges()
Check for outliers for multiple species using temperature ranges from FishBase.
efidata
Efiplus data used to develop ecological sensitivity parameters for riverine species in European streams and rivers.
endemicity()
Determines the species ranges, whether native or alien based on Freshwater Information Platform.
envextract()
Generating pseudo absences from raster layers for distribution modeling.
evaluate()
Model evaluation metrics
exdata()
An internal fucntion to check for missing value in environmental data before estraction.
extractMethods()
List of outlier detection methods implemented in this package.
extract_online()
Extracts data from lists of files obtained from online databases.
extract_outliers()
Extract outliers for a one species
fip_ranges()
Extract basin ranges from Freshwater Information Platform.
fishbase()
Collates synoynm data tables from FishBase.
geo_ranges()
Checks for geographic ranges from FishBase
get_iucn()
Extract species IUCN status from IUCN RedList database.
get_performance()
Extract the model performance
getdata()
Download species records from online database.
getdiff()
get dataframe from the large dataframe.
hamming()
Identify best outlier detection method using Hamming distance.
hampel()
Flag suspicious outliers based on the Hampel filter method..
indep()
threshold independent evaluation
interquartile()
Computes interquartile range to flag environmental outliers
isoforest()
Identify outliers using isolation forest model.
jaccard()
Identifies the best outlier detection method using Jaccard coefficient.
jdsdata
Joint Danube Survey Data
jknife()
Identifies outliers using Reverse Jackknifing method based on Chapman et al., (2005).
kdat
Joint Danube Survey Data
logboxplot()
Log boxplot based for outlier detection.
mahal()
Flags outliers based on Mahalanobis distance matrix for all records.
match.argc()
Customised match function
match_datasets()
Data harmonizing for offline data based on Darwin Core terms .
mdistr_ranges()
Determine species distribution ranges based on IUCN RedList.
medianrule()
Median rule method
mixediqr()
Mixed Interquartile range and semiInterquartile range Walker et al., 2018
modelcomparison()
Comparing the model performance before and after outlier removal.
mth
mth datasets with constant at each confidence interval levels.
mult_abs()
Identifies absolute outliers for multiple species.
multibestmethod()
Identify best method for outlier removal for multiple species using majority votes.
multidetect()
Allows ensemble multiple outlier detection methods.
naturalist
Dataset with species NATURA2000 categories.
naturaranges()
Check if the records are obtained within the NATURA2000 geographical ranges.
ndata
Standard species ecological ranges
ocindex()
Identifies absolute outliers and their proportions for a single species.
onesvm()
Identify outliers using One Class Support Vector Machines
overlap()
Identifies best outlier detection method using Overlap coefficient.
plot(<datacleaner>,<ANY>)
Visualize the outliers identified by each method
pred_extract()
Preliminary data cleaning including removing duplicates, records outside a particular basin, and NAs.
runMerger()
App runner file
sdmfit()
Species distribution modelling
semiIQR()
Computes semi-interquantile range to flag suspicious outliers
seqfences()
Sequwntial fences method
show(<datacleaner>)
set method for displaying output details after outlier detection.
show(<dataonline>)
Method for viewing details of the downloaded data.
smc()
Identify best outlier detection method using simple matching coefficient.
sorensen()
Identifies best outlier detection method suing Sorensen Similarity Index.
sprange()
Detect outliers using predefined optimal ranges such as annual mean temperature from WORLDCLIM
suggested.packages()
Check for suggested packages.
tcatch()
Catch errors during methods implementation.
thermal_ranges()
Collates minimum, maximum, and preferable temperatures from FishBase.
xglosh()
Global-Local Outlier Score from Hierarchies
xkmeans()
Flags outliers using kmeans clustering method
xkmedian()
Using kmedian outlier detection methods
xkmedoid()
kmediod method for outlier detection
xknn()
k-nearest neighbors for outlier detection
xlof()
Flags suspicious using the local outlier factor or Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications with Noise.
zscore()
Computes z-scores to flag environmental outliers.

Developed by h g.
